post.description: Submit credentials and receive a JWT bearer token for accessing the API.

get.summary: Get JWKS for the keys used to sign API tokens
get.description: The JWKS details returned can be used to validate any current API authentication tokens
Download a file stored in the H-POD system, given its GUID
Gets the processing status of a job and any packs identified in that job

Returns full details of a pack, including references to the PDF for each version of the pack, the pack's status transitions and the recipient and delivery details.

Sample request:
            
    GET /pack/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012

400.description: Bad Request - pack GUID not valid or other malformed request

post.description: Requests a preflight run of a file through the system

get.description: Returns the results of a preflight analysis of a document
Retrieves the full set of available settings for use by client software looking to generate a submission to the H-POD system.

post.description:
This endpoint initialises a print job submission, allows you to specify the print options you want to use for the submission,
and returns you a job GUID which you will use with your subsequent calls to provide the document data and signal that the job is ready for processing.
Provides a part of a document to be included with the submission.  A part can be no larger than 250KB in size.
Indicates that all document data has been provided and that the job should be committed to the H-POD system.

instance.description: This should be set to the instance of H-POD you're authenticating against.  Please request this value from your H-POD provider.

jobGUID.description: The GUID of the submission you're committing

extractAddress.description: Indicates whether the system should scrape the address from the first page of the PDF and validate it, returning validation information directly in the response to this call

abortOnValidationFailure.description: If initial address validation fails, indicate whether the commit should still be completed and the document committed for processing

exportReady.description: Indicates whether the PDF being supplied requires no further processing or analysis by H-POD and that it should be moved directly to the "ready to export" stage

recipients.description: If exportReady is true and so the address will not be extracted from the submitted PDF by H-POD, the recipient data should be specified here.

tags.name: Blob
tags.description: Endpoints for uploading and downloading files (blobs) within the H-POD system

tags.name: Preflight
tags.description: Endpoints for initiating and retrieving the results of a preflight request

tags.name: Authenticate
tags.description: Authenticate and receive a token for accessing the API

tags.name: Job
tags.description: Endpoints for querying submitted jobs in the H-POD system

tags.name: Pack
tags.description: Operations on packs.  A pack is a single letter to a single recipient within the H-POD system.

tags.name: Print
tags.description:
Endpoints for initiating, submitting and committing a print job to the H-POD system.

A submission will require the following steps as a minimum

1. A call to Initialise to create the submission, specify the processing options and acquire a job GUID
2. One or more calls to Document Part to provide the document for submission
3. A call to Commit to finalise the submission and indicate further settings for processsing

Initialising a submission will involve populating a number of settings, the available options for which can
be retried by a call to the Get Configuration endpoint.
